title: Ferguson: protesters take to streets in 'dozens' of US cities âÂ live | US news | The Guardian
summary: teargas used against protestors in ferguson throwing molotov cocktails .
officer wilson says there was nothing he would have done differently .

text: police chiefs in ferguson , missouri , give a press conference after a night of violence following the acquittal of the officer who shot 18-year-old michael brown .
a grand jury failed to indict officer darren wilson for shooting the unarmed teenager in august .
forty-four people were arrested on tuesday night as violent protests continued
more than 100 protesters were arrested in los angeles , according to marcus yam from the la times .
marcus yam ( @ yamphoto ) over a hundred protesters were arrested and the busses are filling up .
# ferguson # michaelbrown protests day 2 .
police remarked on the calmness of those arrested .
ruben vives ( @ latvives ) one by one , demonstrators are being taken into custody and transferred into a bus .
# fergusonverdict # dtla

here 's a summary of how things stand after a second night of protests over a grand jury 's decision not to indict the white police officer darren wilson over the killing of black teenager michael brown : a show of force by police and the us national guard in ferguson , missouri , prevented a second night of widespread rioting .
police made 44 arrests and fired teargas to disperse protesters outside ferguson city hall .
police were pelted with rocks , bricks and bottles of urine , and they seized a molotov cocktail , but there no incidents of arson .
generally it was a much better night , said st louis chief jon belmar .
protests at police violence have occurred in a number of cities across the us including new york and los angeles .
in cleveland hundreds of people , angered by the killing of a black 12-year-old over the weekend , blocked rush hour traffic .
in los angeles more than a 100 protesters were arrested for failing to disperse .
a ferguson protests is due to take place outside the us embassy in london on wednesday evening .
barack obama said there was no excuse for burning buildings , torching cars and destroying property .
but the president said he understood that many people were upset by the grand jury 's decision .
the frustrations that we 've seen are not about a particular incident .
they have deep roots in many communities of color who have a sense that our laws are not always being enforced uniformly or fairly , obama said .
darren wilson has insisted in a televised interview that his actions were not motivated by race and that there was nothing he could have done to avoid the tragedy .
the reason i have a clean conscience is that i know that i did my job right , he told abc news .
brown 's family lawyer said the us justice system was broken and had failed young black people .
all across america , whether it 's in new york , los angeles , california or cleveland , young people of colour are being killed by police officers , said attorney benjamin crump .
hundreds of national guard troops have begun leaving ferguson to be replaced by regular police officers .
they are being driven out by bus , according to reports .
the change of guard reinforces the confidence the authorities appearing to be showing in order being restored to ferguson .
around 2,000 national guard troops were dispatched to the st louis area to help police stifle a second night of rioting .
emily rau ( @ emilyrau ) seeing buses taking out national guard troops .
police seem to have taken over patrol of s. florissant .
# ferguson
the fbi agents shot in hanley hill have non-life threatening injuries , according to reporters at the scene .
it is unclear whether the incident is connected to the nearby ferguson protests over michel brown 's death .
ryan dean ( @ ryandeanksdk ) turn on # ksdk .
2 fbi agents shot this morning in hanley hills .
non-life threatening injuries .
info from stl co police
ferguson protesters in los angeles are going quietly , according to angel jennings from the la times .
angel jennings ( @ latangel ) protesters are peacefully surrendering themselves in pairs .
officers are making arrest without incident .
she counted at least 13 arrested , and has images of some being led away in handcuffs .
angel jennings ( @ latangel ) # 13 # la # mikebrownprotest angel jennings ( @ latangel ) # 9 and # 10
two fbi agents have been shot five miles south of ferguson city hall , according to reports .
the incident occurred in hillsdale , a north-west suburb of st louis .
the condition of the agents is unknown at this stage .
ksdk newschannel 5 ( @ ksdknews ) # breaking : 2 fbi agents have been shot at a home in hillsdale , intersection monroe and hanley .
unknown conditions says st. louis co pd .
they were shot just after 3am after responding to a call from someone barricaded in a home , according to the local broadcaster .

documents.title: london protest planned
text: outrage over the grand jury 's decision not indict darren wilson is to take on an international dimension , with a protest planned outside the us embassy in london .
the organisers , stand up to racism , are urging protesters to gather at grosvenor square at 5.30pm on wednesday .
speakers will include carol duggan , aunt of mark duggan , who was shot dead by police in august 2011 , sparking the biggest riots in modern english history .
she said : murder is not legitimate .
no one should lose their child .
michael brown has not got justice and neither has mark duggan .
the police are there to protect , not to kill our children .
the labour mp diane abbott is backing the protest .
she said : my deepest sympathies go out to the family of mike brown .
not only have they lost a loved one but following the grand jury 's decision they no doubt feel the strongest sense of injustice , which can only make their pain worse .
the anger and disruption that has already followed this decision extends beyond the killing of mike right to the root of longstanding issues with the criminal justice system .
just as in britain , the black community in the us has a fraught history with the police .
it is one of the reasons i have always been against the arming of police .
police in los angeles have begun rounding up ferguson protesters , according to reporters at the scene .
marcus yam ( @ yamphoto ) protester sits on the road in anticipation of arrest by lapd .
# michaelbrown # ferguson protests , day 2 .

angel jennings ( @ latangel ) dozens of officers in riot gear have surrounded about 30 protesters at temple and broadway # la # mikebrownprotest angel jennings ( @ latangel ) a silent stand-off between at least a hundred cops in riot gear and about 30 protesters trying not to get arrested .
# la # mikebrownprotest jon passantino ( @ passantino ) lapd now arresting ferguson protesters gathered downtown .
view from knbc chopper angel jennings ( @ latangel ) two police buses arrived to carry 30+ protesters who are being detained at temple/broadway # mikebrownprotest # la

a show of force by police and the us national guard in ferguson , missouri extending to soldiers helping to arrest protesters on american soil had prevented a second night of widespread rioting by early on wednesday , reports jon swaine , paul lewis and adam gabbatt in their latest dispatch from ferguson .

while smouldering sections of the town remained shut down as potential crime scenes , extra troops in camouflage and heavily armed law police officers in riot gear appeared determined to prevent a repeat elsewhere of monday night 's scenes of mass looting and arson .

that intense unrest , leading to dozens of arrests , followed the decision by a grand jury not to charge police officer darren wilson with any state crime for shooting dead michael brown , an unarmed 18-year-old , on a residential side-street in the town on 9 august .
after accusations of being caught flat-footed on monday , teams of law enforcement officers responded swiftly to shut down reports of criminal activity .
i think generally it was a much better night , st louis county police chief jon belmar said at a 1.30am press conference .
he said officers showed restraint and some protesters had been out there for the right reasons .
police repeatedly shot teargas canisters and pepper spray at a boisterous crowd outside ferguson 's city hall , after windows on the building were smashed and a police car outside was partly burned .
officers seized a molotov cocktail at the site , said belmar .
in all , police made 44 arrests , belmar said , including four for the felony charges of unlawful use of a weapon and assaulting police officers .
police also seized two pistols and collected items such as rocks , tent poles and plastic bottles full of urine that they said were thrown .
national guardsmen could be seen taking at least one demonstrator into custody at the ferguson police headquarters , where several people were arrested in the latest nightly clash .

the actions were a significant expansion in the responsibilities of the volunteer soldiers , who had previously only helped guard after governor jay nixon ordered in 700 more troops on monday to bring the total to 2,200 since he declared a state of emergency last week , the soldiers were also lining streets , guarding businesses and utility stations around the town .
a car was burned and gunfire heard near the site of brown 's death , belmar said .
a group tried to loot a walgreens that was robbed and torched on tuesday .
others smashed store fronts and threw stones at several police cars after being forced away from the police department .
shortly after midnight , as a crowd that had been hurling rocks at a glass shopfront melted away , one police officer could not contain an emotional outburst .
you call this peaceful protest ?
he shouted at them .
no families can get to shop .
no baby food .
there 's no milk .
they ca n't even go to work tomorrow .
they 've got christmas coming up and thanksgiving .
all these people protesting ruined everything everything in this city .
twenty-five years i 've been in this city and this is terrible .
when women tried to shout the police officer down , he shouted back .
yeah , whatever , he said .
destroy our town .
yet incidents were kept isolated and brief by police and national guard troops arriving in high-speed convoys and ordering people to leave .
reviving a tactic used during unrest after brown 's death in august , they simply declared demonstrations illegal and cleared the streets .
volunteers and clergy also intervened several times to de-escalate tensions during standoffs at the police headquarters .

as ferguson residents and business owners attempted to count the cost of monday 's damage , police chiefs appeared to concede that they had underestimated the potential for such widespread destruction despite having had three months since the earlier protests over brown 's death to prepare .
belmar said that he and colleagues had not really envisioned how bad last night was , adding : i think that was a scale that fortunately is seldom seen here in this country .
captain ron johnson of the missouri state highway patrol said : none of us could have imagined that last night was going to be what it was .

a police officer puts a fire out after protesters try to burn a ferguson police car in front of city hall the night after protesters burned buildings in protest of the grand jury decision not to indict police officer darren wilson in shooting death of michael brown w. smith/epa

documents.title: cleveland protest
text: demonstrators block public square tuesday , nov. in cleveland , during a protest over the weekend police shooting of tamir rice .
the 12-year-old was fatally shot by a cleveland police officer saturday after he reportedly pulled a replica gun at the city park .

dejak/ap several hundred people temporarily blocked rush-hour traffic on a busy road in cleveland while protesting about the police shooting of a 12 year old boy who reportedly brandished a replica gun , ap reports .

police diverted traffic but did n't take action against the protesters , who chanted phrases such as hands up , do n't shoot and no justice , no peace as they sat in a major intersection before marching past city hall and onto state route 2 .
the protesters were demonstrating after the death of tamir rice , who was shot saturday when police responded to an emergency call about a gun at a playground .
police later determined tamir had an airsoft gun , which ty shoots tiny plastic pellets , but it was missing its orange safety indicator .
the crowd blocked the freeway for about an hour before returning to a downtown square , where it dispersed .
the demonstrators passed by the cuyahoga county jail , causing inmates to bang on their windows .

among the protesters was 17-year-old naesha pierce , who said she had stayed up until 3am watching television news coverage from ferguson , where people marched in streets , destroyed police cars and set businesses on fire .
the system was n't made to protect us , she said .
to get justice , the people themselves have to be justice .
the crowd included people of various races and groups of students from at least three area colleges .
attorneys for tamir 's family have asked police to release the complete surveillance video of the confrontation between him and the officer .
police allowed the family 's attorneys to watch the video on monday and said they would release video footage on wednesday .
officials noted that the video is considered evidence and said they wanted to be sensitive to the family , the community and the officer , whom they described as distraught .
police say tamir was told to raise his hands but pulled what appeared to be a handgun from his waistband .
police say the video is clear , but they would n't discuss details of what it shows .
jody avirgan ( @ jodyavirgan ) tonight 's the night that shutting down a freeway became a common protest tactic .
baltimore , detroit , cleveland , nyc
st louis county police department has published images on its facebook page of the items confiscated from protesters .
they included bottles , rocks , pieces of brick and concrete , and a molotov cocktail - although it is not entirely clear whether the char shown is full of petrol or urine .
here are the main points from belmar and johnson 's press conference : a group of rioters attacked ferguson city hall damaging windows and a police car parked outside .
police used teargas to disperse the rioters the only time teargas was used on tuesday night .
a molotov cocktail was seized in church street in front of the city hall .
an arrest was made .
it took up to 35 minutes to control the riot , belmar said .
there was damage to windows on both sides of florissant road , south of the police department , where there was also attempted looting .
a car was set on fire in the canfield area near the michael brown memorial and shots were fired .
two guns were seized by police including a 9mm semi automatic pistol .
protesters pelted police with an array of objects including bottles of urine , rocks , electrical sockets , asphalt , and tent poles .
generally officers acted with an incredibly amount of bearing and discipline , belmar said .
police arrested 44 people , the majority for misdemeanours such as failure to disperse .
they included four felony arrests , including for the unlawful use of a weapon and assaults on police officers .
in contrast to monday night there were no arsons , despite a number of reports of arson .
generally it was a much better night , belmar said .
johnson said the some of the peaceful protesters helped police to maintain order .

a lot of the protesters who came out for a peaceful protest , were actually assisting us , but once again there are those who are stuck on violence that embed themselves with the peaceful protesters , he said .
belmar paid tribute to the outstanding support role played by the national guard .
they can really fill in the gaps for us , he said .
belmar added : you see them along south florissant road .
while in many ways while it is perhaps alarming to some folks , at the same time it is comforting to some , because it allows us to gain that measure of control .
johnson admitted to be surprised by the scale of the unrest on monday night .
none of us could have imagined last night could have been what it was , he said .
i do n't think anybody thought it would be this magnitude we have not seen anything like this , he added .
here 's an audio recording of that police press conference given by belmar and johnson .
it was conducted in front of a up truck displaying some of the items seized by police including the molotov cocktail .
andre hepkins ( @ andrehepkins ) # missouri highway patrol & @ twitterid addressing media about 44 arrests overnight # ferguson @ twitterid # kmov
police captain ron johnson said his officer had never witnessed anything on the scale of the unrest of monday night .
he talked about the importance of partnership with the local community in quelling the unrest .
some of the peaceful protesters were actually helping us tonight , johnson said .
belmar paid tribute to the national guard troops .
he said they had been outstanding .
he conceded that their presence may be alarming to some , but they were comforting to others .

documents.title: 44 arrests in ferguson
text: st louis police chief jon belmar is giving a press conference .
he said the police seized a molotov cocktail as well as two guns .
police made 44 arrests tonight , most for minor offences , he added .
generally it was a much better night , belmar said .
the presence of hundreds of national guard troops has made a big difference on the level of unrest in ferguson , according to the associated press .
but with hundreds of additional national guard troops assisting police , the latest demonstrations had far less of the chaos and destruction that erupted after monday 's announcement .
however , officers still used some tear gas and pepper spray , and protesters set a squad car on fire and broke windows at city hall .

in the aftermath of monday 's violence , missouri governor jay nixon sent a large contingent of extra national guard troops , ordering the initial force of 700 to be increased to 2,200 in hopes that their presence would help local law enforcement keep order in the st. louis suburb .
lives and property must be protected , nixon said .
this community deserves to have peace .
guard units protected the ferguson police department and left crowd control , arrests and use of tear gas to local officers .
outside police headquarters , one woman was taken into custody after protesters hurled what appeared to be smoke bombs , flares and frozen water bottles at a line of officers .
several other protesters were arrested after defying police instructions to get out of the street or out of the way of police vehicles .
as a crowd of protesters dispersed early wednesday , some threw rocks through the windows of a muffler shop and a used-car dealership , near a painted mural that read peace for ferguson .
some streets that had been overrun the previous night were deserted , except for the occasional police cruiser or national guard vehicle .
guard crews stood watch in empty parking lots .
mo public safety ( @ mopublicsafety ) the missouri national guard ( @ missouri ng ) standing with local police for add'l security at # ferguson police dept .
it 's been remarkable to see the national guard stationed around ferguson .
a notable theme from the protest tonight is a more overt police presence .
here 's a short collection of some quite incredible photos of officers station around the city : deray mckesson ( @ deray ) national guardsman are stationed from the pd to walgreens .
unreal .
# ferguson russ ptacek reports ( @ russptacek ) national guard unit posted outside hooters in downtown st louis .
my colleague paul lewis is on the streets of ferguson still and shot this video a short time ago .
here 's the video and paul 's dispatch : i shot this video shortly after midnight .
disturbances in ferguson have been sporadic and small scale ; nowhere near the intensify of monday 's unrest .
but there has been violence , with police cars attacked , windows smashed and several arrests .
this cop was shouting at the crowds as they melted away .
he was clearly furious with them for the harm he said they had caused the community on the eve of holiday season .
there 's more updates coming in from los angeles still from my colleague rory carroll .

here 's the latest he 's filed : television images showed a small group of protestors in oakland breaking away from what had been a largely peaceful gathering and smashing its way into a car dealership .
bonfires of debris burned nearby .
sirens wailed and helicopters hovered overhead .

other images showed that some of the rowdy protestors were white , prompting @ twitterid¬ , an african american who describes himself as an activist and stanford graduate , to tweet a reproach : black folk to mostly white anarchists : why are you burning shit here ?
why do n't you burn shit where ppl in power are ?
for a primer on oakland 's radical roots and its testy relationship with tech settlers here 's a piece i wrote in february .
the st louis county police department have just posted a series of updates about events in ferguson , including what they say appear to be bottles of urine thrown at police .
st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) small group of protesters left # ferguson pd , broke windows on s. florissant .
at least one business damaged .
rocks thrown at police cars .
st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) protesters are vandalizing businesses along s. florissant at this time .
breaking windows of a meineke store .
# ferguson st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) what appears to be urine filled bottles thrown at police .
my colleague nicky woolf has been in new york following the protests there .
he 's just sent through this lively exchange he had with a police officer in harlem : earlier , as protesters marched through harlem , i spoke to one of the cops walking alongside .
he 'd been walking with the protesters for three and a half hours .
i ask him what he makes of it all .
well , he says , then pauses .
he is silent a long time .
i do n't think they 're taking it the right way , he says eventually .
one cop kills a guy , does n't mean we 're all killers , he says .
he quotes a chant the crowd were using earlier .
'nypd-kkk ? '
he shakes his head .
there is another long pause .
hands up , do n't shoot , the crowd chant in the background .
i 'm not a racist , the cop says , a little sadly .
then he treads in the remains of the largest dead rat i have ever seen .
the other cops - and some of the nearby protesters - laugh good-naturedly .
it is a very new york moment .

just to provide some further context for what is happening tonight , there 's been some extremely thorough analysis of documents that have been released from the grand jury deliberations that are worth canvassing briefly .
my colleagues in the us have developed a remarkable repository of the interview transcripts , witness statements and other documents .
excerpts of the documents have been published to draw attention to key points , while the documents are also available in full ( with the helpful addition of being fully text searchable ) .
npr has also published a similar a similar resource , pulling together their analysis of key documents from the deliberations .
the washington post have taken a more visually based approach , and developed a compelling graphic presentation drawn from the evidence .
this included an outline of wilson 's injuries and brown 's autopsy report , as well as an explanation of what ferguson police collected from the scene .

my colleague jon swaine has also annotated the announcement on monday evening by st louis county prosecutor bob mcculloch to expand on the key points and analyse what was emphasised and what was n't in the announcement .
returning to events in ferguson , where there are still tensions despite a diminished number of protesters .
my colleague jon swaine is now reporting that police are threatening reporters with arrest if they refuse to leave some areas .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) police threatening reporters with arrest if they do n't leave the area # ferguson
my colleague rory carroll has just filed another update from the protests occuring in downtown la .
protestors in oakland lit bonfires made of debris and rubbish , creating a dramatic , improvised barricade across telegraph avenue .
earlier in the evening groups lobbed bricks and bottles at police .
historically , oakland is a crucible of black empowerment and left-wing activism .

there are also some reports of looting occuring at a t-mobile store on telegraph avenue saeed ahmed ( @ saeedcnn ) looters appear to be ransacking a t-mobile store on telegraph ave in oakland ryan parker ( @ theryanparker ) breaking : looting has begun in oakland .
# ferguson
good evening , i 'll be taking from my colleague oliver laughland and continuing our rolling coverage of the protests taking place .
here 's a short summary of how things currently stand : protests are continuing to occur across the country after the announcement on monday evening over the grand jury decision .
the rallies have varied in their sizes and scope and have occured in new york , los angeles , missouri and cities all across the country .
teargas was fired at protesters in ferguson as police attempted to disperse protesters .
reports have also indicated that the national guard is also assisting with arrests in ferguson .
we 'll be continuing to bring you updates as events continue this evening .
with that i 'm handing over this blog to my colleague paul farrell in sydney .

guardian reporter in los angeles rory carroll has the latest from protests at the lapd downtown headquarters : as the evening has worn on parts of the crowd in front of the lapd headquarters has become more agitated , throwing rocks and traffic cones and rattling the metal fences manned by officers in riot gear .
fuck the police !
shouted one man .
we 've got you surrounded lapd !
shouted another .
others chanted : whose streets ?
our streets !
the protest remained largely peaceful , however , and by 9pm local time some people started to drift away .
the rally started hours earlier in balmy sunshine a contrast to the numbing chill in ferguson in crenshaw , a predominantly african american neighbourhood .
several people lay down at intersections , blocking traffic , as they marched the seven miles to police headquarters .

police helicopters hovered overhead and officers on the ground escorted the crowd but kept a distance , in keeping with chief charlie beck 's instructions to let people peacefully protest other protests unfolded along the west coast in portland , seattle , san francisco and oakland , where some protestors blocked a freeway for the second consecutive night .
meanwhile there are reports that protestors have set bonfires alight in oakland , california saeed ahmed ( @ saeedcnn ) oakland , california : protesters set bonfires on the highway .
# ferguson # michaelbrown

my colleague nicky woolf has been on something of a new york odyssey but has finally made it to protests in harlem , nyc where he tells me around 500 people are still marching : nicky woolf ( @ nickywoolf ) cops walking along behind huge # ferguson protest in # harlem nicky woolf ( @ nickywoolf ) huge # ferguson protest in harlem .
i 'd say at least 500 people , maybe as much as twice or even three times that nicky woolf ( @ nickywoolf ) chants of `` hands up , do n't shoot . ''
a guy shouts from a window at the cops `` what , you gon na shoot me too ? ''
# ferguson # harlem

more images and video from reporters on the ground in ferguson , where it is being reported that the national guard are now assisting police with arrests : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) surreal thing to see in suburban middle america .
national guard soldiers lining a street in # ferguson .
casey nolen ksdk ( @ caseynolen ) more arrests .
@ twitterid ng helping w arrests & guarding # ferguson pd .
many journos , some sparring w officers .

here is a small gallery of protests held around the us : protesters in times square , new york burton/getty images protesters demonstrate in philadelphia , wearing a red slap ' on their faces , to symbolise the slap in the face ' that was the grand jury verdict .

rourke/ap about one thousand demonstrators gather on the steps of the national portrait gallery in washington dc somodevilla/getty images protesters march through the downtown area before blockading all lanes of interstate 75/85 northbound near the atlanta state capitol tulis/ap inmates in the south bay house of corrections put their hands in the air after taping the name mike brown on the window of their cell as demonstrators clash with police on the street below the facility in boston snyder/reuters demonstrators hold up lighted signs spelling out black lives matter ' during a protest in boston snyder/reuters
guardian reporter rory carroll ( @ rorycarroll72 ) has been on the streets with protestors in los angeles .
he has filed this report on the largely peaceful , protests outside the police department 's downtown headquarters .
hundreds of protestors in los angeles are squaring off against police in riot gear outside the police department 's downtown headquarters .
some sat and lay on the street on tuesday night , blocking traffic , while others threw bottles and scuffled with officers manning barricades erected hours earlier .
they chanted we got to fight back and held placards saying stop killer cops .
the crowd was bigger and rowdier than monday but still largely peaceful , with some elements trying to marshall the flow and rein in people who shouted insults at officers .
keep the peace , they urged .
police reported no immediate arrests .
los angeles is almost 2000 miles from ferguson but the african american community here felt the sting of the grand jury 's decision to not charge darren wilson for the killing of michael brown .
the lapd has reformed and improved community relations over the past decade but remains tainted by the four officers who beat savagely beat rodney king .
their acquittal in 1992 sparked riots .
protestors cited king and more recent cases , including the fatal shooting in august of ezell ford , a mentally ill 25-year-old african american .
a fresh rally is expected to be held on wednesday afternoon in front of the courthouse which is a few blocks from the police headquarters .
it appears that a diminished number of protestors made it to times square in new york .

protestors in times squar live tv reports suggest that several hundred protestors in los angeles have made it to the lapd headquarters : nbc los angeles ( @ nbcla ) several hundred # ferguson protesters hold their position outside lapd hq .

live coverage : meanwhile , in ferguson it seems that some protestors have left following the use of teargas by police : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) combination of tear gas , dogs barking and cops with assault weapons drawn has dispersed crowd at # ferguson .
mood now strangely subdued .
meanwhile , protesters in new york city , who have remained peaceful throughout , have reached time square : kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) we have arrived @

st louis county police have just announced that protests in ferguson are now being considered unlawful assembly and those refusing to leave will be subject to arrests : st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) this is now considered an unlawful assembly .
those refusing to leave the area will be subject to arrest .
# ferguson
guardian reporter paul lewis was present in ferguson last night and is tweeting from the ground tonight .
he sends this tweet on comparing both the scale of the protest and the police response : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) the unrest in # ferguson localized and nowhere on scale of last night .
immediate and confrontational show of police force however v different

documents.title: teargas used against protestors in ferguson throwing molotov cocktails
text: guardian reporter jon swaine is near ferguson town hall where he reports molotov cocktails are being thrown by protestors .
the situation is clearly deteriorating in ferguson after a period of tense calm was reported just a couple of hours ago .
jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) molotov cocktails thrown at police near ferguson city hall .
they return with teargas jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) gas and smoke and mace fired at protesters in ferguson along from city hall
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) police with assault rifles on the scene .
four armored personnel carriers .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) protesters scatter after police with assault rifles walk toward protesters .
# ferguson
guardian reporter paul lewis is also on the ground in ferguson on carson road .
he reports a police car has been smashed up by protestors .
live broadcast news in the vicinity suggest the car is now on fire : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) police car smashed up , windows smashed , sound of dogs barking , scuffles breaking out .
# ferguson paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) disorder has broken out again in # ferguson .
police have flooded the street with a show of force .
east of umb bank on carson road .
paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) scene after police car sent on fire # ferguson

more just in from outside the ferguson police department where guardian journalist jon swaine is observing continued confrontations between police and protestors : st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) protesters vandalized a patrol car at florissant and church and are trying to start it on fire .
# ferguson jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) arrest in ferguson

guardian reporter jon swaine reported about 15 minutes ago that police in ferguson fired tear or smoke gas towards protestors gathered at the police department : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) smoke and/or gas fired at ferguson pd police match into crowd st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) reports of bottles and fireworks being thrown at officers in front of # ferguson pd .
officers holding the line .
my colleague raya jalabi and i have compiled a list of all the cities in the us where we know protests have occurred this evening ( disclaimer this is not an exhaustive list ) .
those marked in bold are those we have confirmed ( through social media reporting ) to be ongoing .
the huffington post published a map of expected protests sites earlier this afternoon .
it is viewable here and suggests there are many , many more protests going on around the united states .

oakland washington dc new york city nashville los angeles atlanta dallas denver ferguson st louis minneapolis kansas city seattle boston cleveland chicago baltimore richmond , virginia philadelphia providence , rhode island santa barbara , california
as a brief aside some protestors in new york managed to interfere with a cnn reporter 's live cross on tv .

the results were explicit : jorge rivas ( @ thisisjorge ) cnn just aired 10-seconds of new yorkers chanting `` fck cnn '' it is worth reemphasising at this stages all the protests i 'm monitoring have been almost entirely peaceful thus far .
tensions now appear to be mounting in ferguson , missouri .
guardian reporters jon swaine and adam gabbatt are on the ground there : jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) bad atmosphere all of a sudden at ferguson pd .
police snatched at least two more from edge of wurm tires parking lot .
people pushing back jon swaine ( @ jonswaine ) cops just snatched someone and dragged them across the ground behind the police line at ferguson pd .
a plastic bottle thrown at police st. louis county pd ( @ stlcountypd ) protesters in # ferguson are blocking s. florissant road in front of pd .
they are about to start marching .

one arm of the new york city protest , with around 600 people , just reached the headquarters of the united nations in east midtown manhattan , where they paused for four and half minutes to mark respect for michael brown 's death .
it 's proving quite difficult to monitor the whereabouts of each protest as many do n't seem to have an organised destination .

but it appears there are three confirmed groups in new york - two in manhattan and one in brooklyn : occupy wall street ( @ occupywallstnyc ) we # shutitdown on flatbush demanding # justiceformikebrown my colleague kayla epstein , is on another arm of the manhattan protest that just passed the stock exchange .
she filed these words : on the second night since the grand jury decision in ferguson , protesters in new york have lost none of their fire .
a circle of about a hundred people once more gathered in union square to rally peacefully .
one man kneeled in the center of the crowd , hands bound in chains , as protesters around him held signs and chanted i am michael brown !
the union square protesters then marched south , down broadway .
( another protest reportedly gathered on the fdr ) .
flanked by dozens of police who strolled alongside with hands in their pockets , their numbers swelled to the hundreds by the time they reached new york city hall .
the protesters then formed a massive circle .
a line of men kneeled before the crowd , hands up and linked together with chains .
together they chanted hands up , do n't shoot !
- but the loudest voice of all was a womans , which rang out during a brief pause : we have to remember in the morning too !
the broadway protest is now marching south through the financial district , towards wall street and the birthplace of the occupy wall street movement .
it seems the new york protest is the largest gathering going at the moment , but the sizes of each march is difficult to ascertain .
live news reports and a quick sweep of reliable twitter accounts seem to suggest the other major protests are occurring in atlanta , baltimore , los angeles , washington dc , chicago and oakland .
it appears that the number of protestors in each of these is in the hundreds and not the thousands .

in washington dc : rania khalek ( @ raniakhalek ) burning the us flag at # dcferguson in baltimore : mike hellgren ( @ hellgrenwjz ) happening now : lines of troopers/officers at city hall @ twitterid in new york city : kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) protesters march past chase hq , literally linking arms .
powerful images from # nyc # ferguson protest in fidi
one arm of the new york protest just went past the guardian office on broadway , manhattan ( from where this live blog is being written ) .
my colleague raya jalabi ( @ rayajalabi ) dashed out and recorded it going past ( using my vine account ) .

here 's a short video : oliver laughland ( @ oliverlaughland ) # ferguson protests outside the guardian office in manhattan and another short clip : # ferguson protests go past the guardian office in new york
following that report from adam , it appears a small number of arrests have just been made outside the ferguson police department .
cnn broadcast one of them live .
here is tweeted by a reporter on the scene : trey yingst ( @ treyyingst ) breaking : 2 arrests being made in front of the # ferguson police department
my colleague adam gabbatt ( @ adamgabbatt ) is ferguson and has visited some of the major disturbance sites from yesterday .
he reports that all is calm at the moment and observes a heavy police and national guard presence in the area .
here 's adam 's dispatch : it 's all quiet at the ferguson police department so far .
several businesses close by had windows smashed last night , while later on two police cruisers were set alight .
but the only clue that any of that ever happened now is the increase in businesses with boarded up windows .
around five minutes drive east is west florissant avenue , where several businesses were torched on monday .
a police roadblock restricts access to parts of the street .
one business still accessible is ferguson market and liquor , which was looted during the chaos .
no chance of that right now : 15 national guardsmen surround the building , clad in military fatigues and each armed with automatic weapons .
carlos mcduffie was among the protesters last night and was out again at the store .
he was unimpressed with the show of strength .
this is what our money is being used for right now , he said .
this is what millions of dollars are being used for .
to show what ?
i got big balls ? '
my colleague kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) is at a protest in union square , new york city .
it appears there are a few of gatherings going on in the city .
she sends these update : kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) man kneels , wearing chains , as crowd in union square chant .
`` hands up , do n't shoot ! ''
# ferguson # nyc kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) `` i am # michaelbrown '' crowd chants in call and response .
kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) `` i am - jordan davis ! ''
`` i am - # akaigurley ! ''
`` i am - amadou diallo ! ''
protesters call names of police violence victims kayla epstein ( @ kaylaepstein ) new chant at union square : `` black lives matter !
all lives matter '' # fergsuon

here are some more images of protests going on in cities around the united states : from washington dc : russ ptacek reports ( @ russptacek ) # ferguson in dc mt @ twitterid : at mass and 5th nw. , washington dc from oakland : cyrus farivar ( @ cfarivar ) 2 helicopters already hovering above downtown # oakland .
( # ferguson ) from baltimore : baltimore

local tv news in new york are reporting some protestors at the times square rally have been arrested : nbc new york ( @ nbcnewyork ) watch : arrests in times square as police try to move protesters onto sidewalks # ferguson

here 's the associated press take on president obama 's address from chicago earlier : president barack obama sharply rebuked protesters tuesday night for racially charged violence in missouri , saying there was no excuse for burning buildings , torching cars and destroying other property after a grand jury declined to indict the white police officer who shot a black teenager .

as darkness fell in ferguson , missouri , where authorities hoped to avoid a second night of chaos in the streets , obama said destructive actions are criminal acts and those who responsible should be prosecuted .
to those who think that what happened in ferguson is an excuse for violence , i do not have any sympathy for that .
i have no sympathy at all for destroying your own communities , he said .

obama 's call for calm a night earlier , just after the grand jury 's decision was announced , was not heeded by some in the crowd in the st. louis suburb who burned police cars , smashed and looted storefront windows and fired gunshots .
in a real-time display of the limits of his influence , television networks showed obama 's remarks from the white house on a split screen with live video of the violence .

the president spoke from chicago , a trip planned to focus on immigration but overshadowed by the news the night before of the decision not to indict police officer darren wilson in 18-year-old michael brown 's death .
obama said he understood that many people were upset by that decision .
the frustrations that we 've seen are not about a particular incident .
they have deep roots in many communities of color who have a sense that our laws are not always being enforced uniformly or fairly , obama said .
there are productive ways of responding and expressing those frustrations , and there are destructive ways of responding , he said .
burning buildings , torching cars , destroying property , putting people at risk .
that 's destructive and there 's no excuse for it .
those are criminal acts and people should be prosecuted if they engage in criminal acts .
white house officials are still considering whether obama should travel to ferguson , weighing the importance of the moment with the risk of inflaming tensions .
they say a trip wo n't come this week with the u.s. harvest holiday of thanksgiving , giving them time to watch the response unfold and consider the president 's options .
protests are expected to continue tonight in ferguson and cities around the united states : pzfeed top news ( @ pzfeed ) vigils and protests planned for today across the usa .
# ferguson - in new york city protestors are reported to have briefly shut down one side of traffic at the lincoln tunnel new york city alerts ( @ nycityalerts ) lincoln tunnel has been reopened .
protestors now heading to the fdr drive & 14th st. nypd standing by .

# nyc # ferguson protestors are now reportedly at times square , where hundreds convened yesterday : new york city alerts ( @ nycityalerts ) hundreds protestors now # timessquare # nyc # ferguson via @ twitterid in los angeles : michelle tuzee ( @ abc7michelle ) # ferguson protests continue in leimert park area of los angeles .
in detroit : katrease stafford ( @ katreases freep ) absolutely chaotic scene on gratiot in detroit .
protestors blocking traffic. # ferguson in florida :
wilson 's last full response is particularly striking .
stephanopoulos asks if browns shooting is something that will always haunt you .
i do n't think it 's haunting , i think it 's always going to be something that happened .
you have a clean conscience ?
stephanopoulos asks .
the reason i have a clean conscience is i know i did my job right .
here is wilson 's full account of the chase and subsequent fatal shots : wilson agrees that brown ran around 30-40 feet away from the car .
wilson accepts that brown then stops .
his account continues : when he stops he turns around to face me his right hand immediately goes into his waistband .
his left hand is a fist and he starts charging me .
my initial thought was : is there a weapon in there ? '
wilson says there is no way that brown put his hands up at this moment and describes witness accounts as incorrect .
at that time i gave myself another mental check : can i shoot this guy , legally can i ?
and the question i answered myself was , i have to , if i do n't what if he gets to me ?
wilson says he then fires a number of shots , at which point he notices that at least one of the shots hits brown .
i noticed him flinch a little , wilson says .
he then said he yells again and tells brown to stop coming forward , but brown ignored all the commands he just kept running .
wilson says he shot again and notices that one hit brown .
he then says brown gets closer and wilson shoots him in the head .

here are some fuller quotes on wilson 's account of his initial altercation with brown and the circumstances under which he fired his weapon : on who threw the first punch and brown 's strength : he threw the first punch .
it hit me on the left side of my face i do n't know what , how many hit me after that , i just know there was a barrage of swinging and grabbing and pulling for about ten seconds .

i reached out my window with my right hand to grab onto his forearm because i was going to going to try and move him back and get out of the car and when i felt it i felt the immense power that he had .
the way i 've described it is like a five year-old holding on to hulk hogan .
that 's how big he was a very powerful man .
wilson then says he was punched to the right of his face and then asks himself how do i survive ?
i did n't know if i 'd be able to sustain another hit like that .
on the circumstances of discharging his weapon : wilson then says he took his gun out of his right hip and pointed it at brown .
stand back or i 'm gon na shoot you , he says he told brown .
his response immediately was that he grabbed the top of my gun .
and when he grabbed the top of my gun he said you 're too much of a p to shoot me ' .
and while he 's doing that i can feel his hand come over my hand and get inside the trigger guard and try and shoot me with my own gun , that 's when i pulled the trigger for the first time .
wilson says he tried to pull the trigger twice but it did n't go off as brown 's fingers blocked the trigger guard .
at the third attempt , wilson says he thought : i need to get this one away or i 'm gon na be dead .
so i pull a third time and it finally goes off .
wilson then said he got out of his car and got on his radio .
he was then asked why he did n't stay in the car and let brown walk away .
wilson responds : my job isn '' t to just sit and wait .
i have see where this goes .
he says it was his duty to give chase .
that 's what we 're trained to do .

documents.title: officer wilson says there was nothing he would have done differently
text: i 'll bring you some fuller quotes of wilson 's account of the shooting shortly .
stephanopoulos concludes this segment of the interview with this exchange : stephanopoulos : is there anything you could have done from preventing that killing taking place ?
wilson : no stephanopoulos : nothing ?
wilson : no stephanopoulos then asks wilson if brown were white would it have gone the same way .
wilson says it would have .
he then asks what wilson 's dream is going forward .
to have a normal life , wilson replies .
stephanopoulos then asks by asking if the shooting would haunt him in the future .
it wo n't wilson replies .
he says it was just something that happened .
watch the video :
wilson says he then got out of the car and started chasing michael brown .
i get in my walkie and say shots fired ' and i start chasing michael brown , wilson says .
wilson then reiterates his description of brown as resmbling wrestler hulk hogan .
he was a big guy , wilson says .
wilson then offers an account of the shooting : wilson says he told brown : step back i 'm going to shoot you .
wilson says brown replied : you 're too much of a to shoot me wilson says he then tried to discharge his weapon twice but it did n't go off .
he then says brown gets even angrier his intensity increases .
he then shot the teenager .
the wilson interview begins with stephanopoulos asking about wilson 's account of the altercation with brown by his car .
wilson says he told brown : hey come here for a minute according to wilson brown told the officer : what the fuck you going to do about it ?
then wilson says he slammed the door shut on me he threw the first punch ?
stephanopoulos asks .
yes , wilson replies .
we 're now waiting for the first segment of george stephanopoulos 's interview with wilson , due to air at around 6.30pm et .
remember this interview is expected to be broadcast in three parts .
there was no word in that address of whether president obama will visit ferguson following yesterday 's grand jury decision and he was careful to make his comments general .
here are a few more full quotes from the president .
first he repeated the rhetoric from his address last night immediately after the grand jury 's decision was handed down : the frustrations that we 've seen are not just about a particular incident .
they have deep roots in many communities of colour , who have a sense that our laws are not being reinforced uniformly or fairly .
that may not be true everywhere and its certainly not true for the vast majority of law enforcement officials but that 's an impression that of folks have .
it exists in the reality that folks in this country have experienced for a long time .

he then drew parallels with debate around immigration reform and the racial politics at play in ferguson : being american does n't mean you have to look a certain way or come for a certain place , it has to do with a commitment to ideals .
a belief in certain values .
and if any part of the american community does n't feel welcomed or treated fairly , that 's something that puts all of us at risk
president obama says he has instructed attorney general eric holder to convene a broader investigation into community relations with the criminal justice system .
this will involve state officials and community leaders across the country coming together to ensure law enforcement is far state by state , county by county .
president obama begins his address by directly addressing events in ferguson and their broader significance across the us .
as many of you know a verdict came down that upset a lot of people , he says .
he says that the frustrations has deep roots in many communities who sense that are laws are not being enforced fairly .
that may not be true everywhere .
it 's not just made up .
it 's rooted in realities .
there are productive ways of responding .
there are destructive ways of responding .
torching building , burning cars .
those are destructive ways .
those are criminal acts .
president obama has just started an address in chicago and is expected to comment on last night 's events in ferguson .
we 'll bring you updates as they happen .
good evening and welcome to our continued coverage of fallout from the decision not to indict officer darren wilson over the shooting of unarmed teenager michael brown in ferguson , missouri .
here 's a summary of where things stand : a small number of protesters had returned to the streets in ferguson , missouri , as darkness began to fall .
activists called for continued rallies in solidarity with michael brown .
significant protest activity was under way in other cities as well , including philadelphia , cleveland and atlanta .
organizers said more than 100 protests were planned nationwide .
suspended ferguson police officer darren wilson , who killed the unarmed teenager michael brown in august , sat for an interview with abc news that was expected to air shortly .
missouri officials vowed that tuesday night would not see a repeat of monday 's violence , which governor jay nixon called unacceptable .
nixon said hundreds of national guardsmen would be added to the streets .
our community not only needs to be safe , they need to feel safe , he said .
the family of michael brown called for constructive and peaceful protests .
family representatives attacked a grand jury decision announced monday not to prosecute wilson , saying the process was completely unfair .
speaking on behalf of the family , the rev .
al sharpton advised that a federal investigation of the case was ongoing .
police said a dozen businesses were burned in ferguson overnight and 61 were arrested .
a homicide inquiry was under way in ferguson after a man was found dead in a car with reported burns and gunshot wounds .
